reg.title: Class Size Regulation
reg.amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 205/2008, June 27, 2008]

definition.def: means a group of students regularly scheduled to be together in a classroom for the purposes of instruction in an educational program.

subsection.subsectiontext: For the purposes of section 76.1 (2) [maximum class size for kindergarten and grades 1 to 3] of the Act:

definition.def: means a class containing students in those grades and includes a class containing students in those grades and in any other grade except kindergarten;
means a class containing kindergarten students and includes a class containing kindergarten students and students in any other grade.

subsection.subsectiontext: For the purposes of section 76.1 (2.1) [maximum class size for grades 4 to 7] of the Act, grades 4 to 7 means a class containing students in those grades and includes a class containing students in those grades and in any other grade except kindergarten and grades 1 to 3.
For the purposes of sections 76.1 (2.2) (b), 76.1 (2.3) (b), 76.2 (a) and 76.3 (8) (a) (i) of the Act, consult means

paragraph.paragraphtext: provision by the principal of a school to the teacher of a class with

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: information relevant to a proposal for the size and organization of the class, and

2 school days before a decision is made respecting the size and organization of the class for the teacher to consider the proposal and provide the principal with the teacher's views in that regard, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: consideration by the principal of the teacher's views, if any have been provided,

section.subsandwich: and consulted has a similar meaning.

subsection.subsectiontext: A superintendent of schools for a school district must determine the average size of a board's classes, in the aggregate, as of the following dates, for the purposes of section 76.1 (1) of the Act:

paragraph.paragraphtext: January 15 or May 15 or both, in respect of the board's kindergarten, grades 1 to 3, grades 4 to 7 or grades 8 to 12 classes, if the superintendent has reasonable grounds to believe that the average class size of the board's kindergarten, grades 1 to 3, grades 4 to 7, or grades 8 to 12 classes has increased since the previous determination.

subsection.subsectiontext: If the superintendent determines the average size of a class as of a date referred to in subsection (1) (b), the reference to "September 30" in sections 2 to 4 must be read as "January 15" or "May 15" as applicable.
The average class size, in the aggregate, for kindergarten classes in a school district is determined by the formula:

tablerow.tablecol: the total number of students in kindergarten in the school district, as of September 30;
the total number of kindergarten classes in the school district, as of September 30.

subsection.subsectiontext: For the purposes of counting kindergarten classes under subsection (1), if a class contains kindergarten students and students in another grade, the class must not be counted as one class but as a portion of a class determined by the formula, calculated to one decimal place:

tablerow.tablecol: the number of students in the class in kindergarten;
the number of students in the class.

subsection.subsectiontext: The average class size, in the aggregate, for grades 1 to 3 in a school district is determined by the formula:

tablerow.tablecol: the total number of students in grades 1 to 3 in the school district, as of September 30;
the total number of grades 1 to 3 classes in the school district, as of September 30.

subsection.subsectiontext: For the purposes of counting grades 1 to 3 classes under subsection (1), if a class contains students in grades 1 to 3 and students in kindergarten or another grade, the class must not be counted as one class but as a portion of a class determined by the formula, calculated to one decimal place:

tablerow.tablecol: the number of students in the class in grades 1 to 3;
the number of students in the class.

subsection.subsectiontext: The average class size, in the aggregate, for grades 4 to 7 in a school district is determined by the formula:

tablerow.tablecol: the total number of students in grades 4 to 7 in the school district, as of September 30;
the total number of grades 4 to 7 classes in the school district, as of September 30.

subsection.subsectiontext: For the purposes of counting grades 4 to 7 under subsection (1), if a class contains students in grades 4 to 7 and students in another grade, the class must not be counted as one class but as a portion of a class determined by the formula, calculated to one decimal place:

tablerow.tablecol: the number of students in the class in grades 4 to 7;
the number of students in the class.

subsection.subsectiontext: The average class size, in the aggregate, for grades 8 to 12 in a school district is determined by the formula:

tablerow.tablecol: the total number of students in grades 8 to 12 in the school district, as of September 30;
the total number of grades 8 to 12 classes in the school district, as of September 30.

subsection.subsectiontext: For the purposes of counting grades 8 to 12 under subsection (1), if a class contains students in grades 8 to 12 and students in another grade, the class must not be counted as one class but as a portion of a class determined by the formula, calculated to one decimal place:

tablerow.tablecol: the number of students in the class in grades 8 to 12;
the number of students in the class.

section.sectiontext: In determining class sizes under sections 2 to 4, the superintendent must exclude the following:

paragraph.paragraphtext: a student in an adult or continuing education program;
a student in a distributed learning school;
a class where the educational program is delivered through distributed learning;
a student in a Provincial resource program;
a student in an alternate program;
a student in a work study or work experience program;
a class operated exclusively for students who

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: have learning disabilities or have disabilities of an intellectual, physical, sensory, emotional or behavioural nature, or

subsection.subsectiontext: Subject to subsection (2), on or before October 30 of each year, a board must prepare and submit to the minister a class size data report in the form and manner and containing the information required by the minister.

A board may include the class size data report with the report on organization of classes required under section 76.3 (10) of the Act, unless the board has instructed the superintendent to revise the report under section 76.3 (7) (b).
